Chattanooga Outdoors: 12 Hikes Under 5 Miles

    #outdoors
Chattanooga is a paradise for hikers with its scenic landscapes, lush forests, and beautiful trails. For those looking for shorter adventures, we've compiled a list of fifteen fantastic hikes under five miles. Whether you're a seasoned hiker or a beginner, these trails offer the perfect opportunity to enjoy the great outdoors without committing to a long trek.

1.   Stringers Ridge via Blue Trail

Distance: 3.3 miles
Description: Located near downtown Chattanooga, Stringers Ridge offers a serene escape with stunning views of the city and Tennessee River. The loop trail is perfect for a quick hike and features a mix of wooded paths and open vistas.
Highlights: City views, moderate terrain, close to downtown, excellent for a quick escape into nature.

2.   Rainbow Lake and Bee Branch Trail Loop

Distance: 2.2 miles
Description: This trail on Signal Mountain is known for its picturesque scenery, including a beautiful lake and cascading streams. The relatively easy hike is ideal for families and those looking to enjoy nature without too much exertion.
Highlights: Scenic lake, gentle streams, family-friendly, historical suspension bridge.

3.   Glen Falls Trail

Distance: 1.2 miles
Description: A hidden gem on Lookout Mountain, Glen Falls Trail features a short, easy hike with the reward of a stunning waterfall. The trail winds through lush forest and rocky outcrops, making it a favorite among locals.
Highlights: Waterfall, lush forest, rocky outcrops, picturesque wooden bridge.

4.   Edwards Point Trail

Distance: 3.8 miles
Description: Starting at the Signal Point overlook, this trail leads to Edwards Point, offering breathtaking views of the Tennessee River Gorge. The hike is moderately challenging with a rewarding vista at the end.
Highlights: Panoramic views, moderately challenging, river gorge, ideal for photography.

5.   Cravens House Look Trail

Distance: 3.4 miles
Description: Located on Lookout Mountain, this historic trail begins at the Cravens House and takes you through a scenic forest to Sunset Rock. The trail is moderately difficult but offers beautiful views and historical insights.
Highlights: Historic site, forested trail, Sunset Rock, rich Civil War history.

6.   Lula Lake Classic Loop

Distance: 4.4 miles
Description: Open on the first and last weekends of the month, this trail system features stunning waterfalls and lake views. The main loop is under five miles and offers a moderately easy hike with plenty of natural beauty.
Highlights: Waterfalls, lake views, limited access, requires an entrance fee, great for a weekend adventure.

7.   Big Soddy Creek Gulf

Distance: 3.5 miles
Description: A relatively new addition to Chattanooga's trail system, this trail offers a peaceful hike along Big Soddy Creek. The trail is easy and perfect for a leisurely hike with opportunities for wildlife spotting.
Highlights: Creekside hike, wildlife spotting, peaceful environment, ideal for nature lovers.

8.   Sunset Rock via the Bluff Trail

Distance: 3 miles
Description: Starting from Ochs Gateway, this trail follows the edge of Lookout Mountain and leads to the iconic Sunset Rock. The hike is moderately challenging but offers spectacular views and a rewarding destination.
Highlights: Edge trail, Sunset Rock, spectacular views, perfect for sunset hikes.

9.   Cloudland Canyon West Rim Loop

Distance: 4.7 miles
Description: Just over the Georgia state line, this loop trail in Cloudland Canyon State Park is worth the short drive. The trail offers diverse scenery, including canyon views, waterfalls, and lush forest.
Highlights: Canyon views, waterfalls, diverse scenery, excellent for a scenic day trip.

10.   Harrison Bay: Bay Point Loop

Distance: 4.3 miles
Description: This loop trail in Harrison Bay State Park offers beautiful views of the bay and is suitable for all skill levels. The trail is mostly flat, making it an easy and enjoyable hike.
Highlights: Bay views, flat terrain, wildlife viewing, ideal for a relaxing walk.

11.   Audubon Acres Loop

Distance: 3.3 miles
Description: Located in East Brainerd, Audubon Acres offers a network of trails through lush forests and along South Chickamauga Creek. It's a great spot for bird watching and enjoying nature. Requires an entrance fee.
Highlights: Bird watching, creekside trails, lush forest, educational opportunities.

12.   Enterprise South Nature Park: Poe Run to Hidden Lake

Distance: 2.9 miles
Description: This out-and-back trail through interconnected paths, including the Poe Run Path, totals around 2.9 miles. The trails are well-marked and offer a peaceful hike through wooded areas.
Highlights: Well-marked trails, peaceful environment, wooded paths, excellent for a quick retreat into nature.
